meanings.definition: The act of dividing something into two equal parts.
meanings.sent1: She demonstrated the halvings of the cake by cutting it precisely in the middle.
meanings.sent2: The halvings of the pizza were uneven, causing a dispute over the larger slice.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved the halvings of a rabbit, but it hopped away before he could finish.
meanings.sent4: The halvings of the city between day and night created a beautiful skyline.
meanings.sent5: The halvings of the cookie made it easier to share with her friend.

meanings.definition: The result of cutting something in half.
meanings.sent1: The halvings of the rope were neatly done, allowing both teams to have equal lengths.
meanings.sent2: After the halvings of the watermelon, everyone enjoyed a juicy slice.
meanings.sent3: The halvings of the sandwich were so perfect that it looked like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: The halvings of the year marked the changing seasons with colorful leaves and blooming flowers.
meanings.sent5: The halvings of the paper revealed a hidden message written in invisible ink.
